description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8vss8","text":"This is the basic protocol for antibody staining of formalin fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"dotn8","text":"Principle:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fst1s","text":"For antibody staining to be successful, most FFPE tissue requires antigen retrieval of some kind.  Formalin fixation cross-links proteins during the course of fixation.  Antigen retrieval unlinks the proteins and opens up the antigen sites so that the antibody will be able to bind to them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Preparation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48ain","text":"10% Neutral buffered formalin fixed tissue, or 4% paraformaldhyde fixed tissue, paraffin embedded sections  cut at ~5-6 microns and mounted on charged steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cjaa","text":"Either place slides on a slide warmer with temperature set to approx.  .  Leave the slides on the warming plate until the paraffin looks melted on all of the slides (about 0- ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":174,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"45bod","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"57","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm07n","text":"Fill the vegetable steamer with deionized water to the second line in the transparent corner section of the steamer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dvofp","text":"Add capillary gap slides (same number as the number of slides you are staining) in the slide holder to wet the slides, or if you have a lot of slides, rinse the capillary gap slides separately before use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ehq0","text":"Fill the plastic “boat” containers with approx.   of one of the 1X antigen retrieval solutions (Reveal or citrate buffer).  Pick up a slide (rough side of the capillary gap slide facing the tissue section slide) and put the slides into one of the troughs in the boat container.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4i1ih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a87ck","text":"Push slides toward each other and allow the fluid to come up slowly between the two slides.  Try not to get bubbles between the slides or this will obstruct the antigen retrieval process and give you uneven staining. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1r3et","text":"Put the “boats” into the steamer and set for  .  This will allow the steamer to come up to temperature and the slides will steam for about  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":139,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4pfp1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2100,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7e48b","text":"Remove clear basket from the steamer and allow slides to cool for about   to room   temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"95vh5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5njqk","text":"Transfer the “boats” of slides to the inner steamer container and rinse with running water for about 10- .  Unpeel the slides from each other and transfer the slides to the gray slide holder for a final rinse (~ ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":211,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"shhq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l17n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3cd2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdolf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":29,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ek2j1","text":"Alternative microwave method:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":190}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7jkti","text":"If you don’t have the vegetable steamer you can do antigen retrieval in the microwave by putting the slides in a plastic coplin jar filled with citrate buffer. Microwave slides/solution for  . on high power (~700 watts). Make sure slides are still covered with retrieval solution or add fresh solution and repeat microwaving.  This process can be repeated 2-3 times.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":70}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6f7ui","text":"Let slides slowly cool in coplin jar to room temperature for approx.   .","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b1juq","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"},"1":{"data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74h2k","text":"Dilute or use prediluted TRIS (1x concentration )  for  , approx  -  per slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cv518","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avj9","text":"3% Hydrogen peroxide made in 1X TRIS for 10- .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mh61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"apmvj","text":"Rinse slides in 1X TRIS and add to slides for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2hdit","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1o6t","text":"100% Background Sniper for nearly  .  Do not go longer than  . (alternative: 10% normal goat serum made in 1X TRIS or PBS can be substituted for  ) or 1% sodium borohydride made in 1X TRIS soln to decrease autofluoresence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":145,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ibur","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":780,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8a0f8","text":"Make up antibody solution or a cocktail of multiple antibodies at desired concentration in a diluent of  5% Sniper in 1X TRIS solution.  Using approx.   per slide, make up enough antibody to cover all slides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":151,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6q4un","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4epnj","text":"Cover the slides with either a glass coverslip (24 x 60 mm) or parafilm and put in a  refrigerator  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":85,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":99,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6s0kt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"490eg","text":"Take slides out of the refrigerator and warm up to room temperature about 15- .  Remove the cover slips and cover the slides with 1X TRIS solution for a few minutes.  Rinse off the antibody solution with 1X TRIS   x 2.  At this stage you will need to use the black staining box to keep the reagents from light exposure.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":77,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":212,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6l57m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cuuji","text":"Secondary reagent/antibody for 1- .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fgtjo","text":"Apply the secondary reagent appropriate to the antibody, i.e., if your antibody was raised in a rabbit, you will apply a fluorescent antibody such as Jackson goat anti-rabbit 488 (yellow in tube, excites to green in IF light) using about -  per slide or enough of the reagent to totally cover the tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":237,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":239,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"25cja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5okhc","text":"If your antibody was raised in some other animal, you will have to find a secondary to that animal, i.e., donkey anti-mouse, goat anti-rat, etc.  Usually a dilution of  1:300 to 1:500 in a diluent of 5% Sniper made in 1X TRIS is a good starting concentration to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nvr0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9loul","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"po48","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q0fc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"634nt","text":"Often a cocktail of 2 secondary antibodies is used for dual chromogen staining.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d7u9n","text":"In this case, be careful to combine both chromogens in correct ratios with the diluent.  If the secondary has glycerol added (which is often the case to keep the solution from freezing), you will have to double the amount of antibody used.    Jackson ImmunoResearch sells a host of secondary antibodies. Colors 594 excites red, 488 excites green…","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s1sf","text":"Rinse slides with 1X TRIS; 5 min x 3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drms3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg8fj","text":"If you do not want to use the solutions to block autofluorescence, mount slides in dim light conditions with Prolong gold with DAPI.  The dapi will stain the nuclear elements blue.  Cover slides in a slide box or tin foil to dry overnight at room temperature to set the mounting media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"9537f","text":"Precautions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34p9k","text":"Personal Protection: Gloves, lab coat, goggles, fume hood, and use of universal precaution practices.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"459mm","text":"Chemical Wastes: Dispose of alcohols, dyes, and xylene in appropriate labeled waste containers as directed by the University of Minnesota Hazardous Chemical Waste Management Manual 5th Edition.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gvou","text":"Hazards: Xylene = Flammable, Carcinogen, Skin irritant, Eosin \u0026 Alcohols = Flammable, Skin irritant    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu3cn","text":"Hematoxylin = Skin irritant, Avoid strong oxidizers with all listed chemicals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
